description: Students trace and integrate the African-American and Euro-American dance traditions of the
late 19th, 20th and early 21st centuries, paying attention to their similarities and differences.
The focus is on the theatrical dance genres of ballet, modern, and jazz (includes
social dance, tap, and some musical theatre dance).  At the same time, the course attends
to the economic, religious, political, and social forces that have affected the development
of dance in the United States. Prerequisite: Dance 100 Introduction to Dance or
permission of instructor. Ticket/transportation fee required.  Offered annually in the spring
semester. Counts towards ARMS and American studies majors and ARMS concentration.
